title: Instrument all dashboard widgets for load, render, and interactive readiness timing
summary: Instrument each dashboard widget to measure key performance timings, including load, render, and when interactive. Data collection should have minimal performance overhead and support observability for first- and third-party widgets.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: instrumenting widgets to capture load, render, and interactive readiness times; ... no analytics degradation of dashboard performance

title: Capture and report widget timing data per user, device, and browser context
summary: Collect and report detailed timing data for each widget, segmented by user, device type, and browser context. Enables data-driven performance analysis and targeting of optimizations.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: reporting per widget, user, device, and browser

title: Provide engineering dashboards with breakdowns by widget, user segment, and time window
summary: Engineering dashboards must display performance metrics with granular breakdowns by widget, user segment, and configurable time windows to support monitoring and analysis activities.

title: Implement outlier and regression flagging with root-cause drill-downs
summary: The system must automatically detect and flag performance outliers and regressions, providing tools for root-cause drill-down investigation to assist in diagnostics.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: breakdowns and root-cause drilldowns; automated alerting for SLA breaches

title: Trigger automated alerts for widgets exceeding performance SLAs
summary: Automated alerting must be set up to notify stakeholders when widget performance metrics breach defined SLAs such as 95th percentile thresholds, supporting rapid incident response.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: automated alerting for SLA breaches (e.g., 95th percentile >2s);

title: Integrate performance checks with CI/CD for deployment blocking/regression prevention
summary: Integrate automated performance testing into the CI/CD pipeline to block deployments in case of regressions, ensuring substandard updates do not affect production.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: CI/CD integration to prevent performance regressions

title: Suggest automated remediation steps for detected performance regressions
summary: Upon detecting performance regressions, automatically suggest remediation actions such as configuration adjustments, rollbacks, or code fixes to facilitate swift resolution.

title: Monitor fallback performance of external widgets and alert on persistent issues
summary: Continuously monitor the fallback behavior and performance of external widgets, issuing alerts when issues persist to ensure overall dashboard resilience and user experience.

title: Prompt users to hide/reprioritize widgets if dashboards exceed performance budgets
summary: Prompt end users to hide or reprioritize dashboard widgets if overall performance budgets are breached, thereby maintaining usability and allowing personal customization.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: user prompt if dashboard is slow

title: Anonymize performance telemetry and ensure user privacy compliance with opt-out
summary: Anonymize all collected performance telemetry, enforce privacy compliance per user agreements, and provide a clear opt-out mechanism to maintain user trust.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: anonymized telemetry data adhering to privacy agreements with user opt-out and transparency

title: Provide users transparency and option to view and opt-out of data collection
summary: Enables SaaS users to view what data is being collected and gives them control to opt-out of anonymized telemetry. Ensures transparent communication and allows compliance with user privacy preferences. This feature supports adherence to privacy standards and regulations.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: anonymized telemetry data adhering to privacy agreements with user opt-out and transparency

title: Implement self-service analytics for product owners to monitor widget health
summary: Offers product owners analytics dashboards to independently monitor the health and performance of their widgets. Self-service capabilities include real-time metrics, error rates, and actionable insights, supporting both performance assessment and SLA compliance.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: self-service analytics for product owners; reporting per widget, user, device, and browser; engineering dashboards with breakdowns and root-cause drilldowns
